data.title: Car mechanic
data.statement: A mechanic is trying to fix a broken part of a car using parts available in his inventory. Your task is to determine if the mechanic can fix the car by finding a substring in the <<availableParts>> string that matches the <<brokenPart>> string, allowing at most one mismatch between the characters.
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
read availableParts:string(n)
read m:int
read brokenPart:string(m)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: integer [[n]]
<<Line 2>>: string [[availableParts]] of lowercase english letters (a - z) of length [[n]]
<<Line 3>>: integer [[m]]
<<Line 4>>: string [[brokenPart]] of lowercase english letters (a - z) of length [[m]]
data.outputDescription:
{{Original}} if found substring is exact to <<brokenPart>>
{{Alternative}} if found substring has one letter different from <<brokenPart>>
{{Missing}} if there is no matching substring

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

A mechanic is trying to fix a broken part of a car using parts available in his inventory. Your task is to determine if the mechanic can fix the car by finding a substring in the availableParts string that matches the brokenPart string, allowing at most one mismatch between the characters.
Input
Line 1: integer n
Line 2: string availableParts of lowercase english letters (a - z) of length n
Line 3: integer m
Line 4: string brokenPart of lowercase english letters (a - z) of length m
Output
Original if found substring is exact to brokenPart
Alternative if found substring has one letter different from brokenPart
Missing if there is no matching substring
Constraints
10 <= n <= 100
2 <= m <= 20
Example
Input
26
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
3
agc
Output
Alternative
